definition: to hold/to embrace/to wrap around/to gather around (sb)/to throng/to swarm/to support/Taiwan pr. [yong3]
to block up (a road, pipe etc)/to stop up (a hole)/(fig.) (of a person) choked up with anxiety or stress/wall (literary)/(classifier for walls)

sentences.english: A big traffic jam behind the column.
sentences.chinese: 圆柱后是一次严重的交通拥堵。

sentences.english: Another vehicle on road will increase traffic jamm ???
sentences.chinese: 公路上又多了一种机车，会加剧交通拥堵的？

sentences.english: A prime goal of these regional networks will be to alleviate travel congestion.
sentences.chinese: 这些区域铁路网的最终目的是解决交通拥堵问题。

sentences.english: But the third-worst spot for highway congestion, Chicago's CircleInterchange, is going nowhere.
sentences.chinese: 但名列第三位拥堵的芝加哥环路交口却还不知去向。

sentences.english: because there's a big congestion charge if you live in the centre.
sentences.chinese: 因为如果你住在市中心，拥堵费就要一大笔钱。

sentences.english: because if you take it during the day, there'll be a lot of traffic and congestion.
sentences.chinese: 因为如果你白天坐，道路会拥堵。
喇叭口拥堵大量的液体沥青。

sentences.english: Therefore, it is necessary to decentralize traffic flow.
sentences.chinese: 治理交通拥堵需要分散交通流。

sentences.english: The accesses to public facilities should be designed to avoid crowdedness.
sentences.chinese: 公共场所入口处在设计时应考虑如何避免拥堵的问题。

sentences.english: Find a bunch of people gather around Tian An Men to make a congestion for 5mins.
sentences.chinese: 找一群人聚集在天安门拥堵此门5分钟。

sentences.english: There is no better writer on traffic jams anywhere in the world.
sentences.chinese: 全世界没有别的作家能把交通拥堵写得更好了。

sentences.english: Suchow creek. Traffic jam. During the last days of the Kuomintang.
sentences.chinese: 国民党政府执政的最后几天中，苏州河航道拥堵。

sentences.english: It is believed the mini-sized car will help to alleviate traffic jams.
sentences.chinese: 此车占地小，利于缓解交通拥堵。

sentences.english: Multi-car pileups closed parts of several major highways Saturday in the Plains states.
sentences.chinese: 许多车辆拥堵在中部平原的几条主要公路上。

sentences.english: And the traffic was really, really heavy.
sentences.chinese: 那时，交通非常非常拥堵。

sentences.english: But the third-worst spot for highway congestion, Chicago\'s Circle Interchange, is going nowhere.
sentences.chinese: 但名列第三位拥堵的芝加哥环路交口却还不知去向。

definition: traffic jam/(of traffic) to get congested
mixed use (e.g. pedestrians and vehicles)/joint operation (e.g. trains and buses)
to go through/to pass through/to be in general use
highway/expressway/same as 高速公路[gao1 su4 gong1 lu4]
to drive a vehicle/movement of vehicles
to pull up (stop one's vehicle)/to park/(of a machine) to stop working/to stall
